attributes.action: Address the issues causing collapse of the insect population & global disaster
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/feb/10/plummeting-insect-numbers-threaten-collapse-of-nature

This issue is more urgent than any economic or national debate on Brexit. There will be no trade deals when there is nothing to trade
attributes.background: The insect population globally is collapsing, This is the bedrock of the global food chain. All life on earth is at risk from plants to animals of all sizes. The human race cannot survive this without addressing the use of pesticides, over population and climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the insect population, but are not sure what action you would like the Government and Parliament to take.

You could start a new petition calling for specific measures to combat declining insect numbers, if that is something you would like to see happen.
